chunks.en: With my current financial situation, can I afford a car around 350,000 yuan? Any recommendations?

I'm 31 this year, no loans, in Shanghai, have a license plate, 4 million yuan in savings, a family of three can save about 180,000 yuan a year. Elders can subsidize 20% of the car purchase. Only considering gasoline cars, any recommendations?
I have driven many European cars (German, Italian, British), and I feel that if I were to buy another car, I would buy a Toyota/Lexus because it is really hassle-free.

My European cars, after about 60,000 kilometers, need a lot of things replaced, including spark plugs, engine oil, brake fluid, transmission oil, front and rear differential oil, antifreeze, etc. Moreover, these parts are terribly expensive. A full set for my current car costs tens of thousands of yuan.
The engine oil alone costs more than 5,000 yuan, using Shell 10-60 custom oil.
Six spark plugs also cost more than 5,000 yuan.
These things must be replaced. If they are not replaced, there will be various minor problems, such as water leaks and oil leaks (BMW is no exception).
So it's really troublesome.

If I buy another car, I will choose a Toyota Camry with a naturally aspirated engine. I don't even need a hybrid. The more electronic features there are, the more failures there will be, and the more difficult it will be to maintain later.
Without specifying the intended use, then get a BRZ.

chunks.en: Imported new Crown sedan, or Genesis G80. Don't follow the crowd when buying a car if you are a person who likes to research.
Suggest keeping the CC. You only have 400,000 yuan in total, and you're buying a car for more than 300,000 yuan... you're really going all in.

@zangai Yes, hybrid is the best solution, and the large bed mode of this car is perfect for traveling. Even the inflatable bed mode of the L9 pales in comparison. You can drive and sleep wherever you go, comfortably and safely. You can stay in the scenic area for a few days, and go to a bath center when you go to the city. You don't need to stay in a hotel at all.
I don't care, I'm going to recommend what I like, the Haval H9 diesel version.
@hallostr Don't buy any used joint venture cars. Isn't it better to take the subway? Save the money and use it to buy a comfortable coffin when you die.
New X3 +1
Adding one more point, it's a trade-in. I'm currently driving a Volkswagen CC, bought in 2016.
New X3 or RX350h / RX300, I recommend the former more, but it's best to wait at least a month or two to buy it. According to BMW's habit, the price will drop in a month or two.
